Message.Msg: Case at point. Today move was fantastic for longs at the 275 dollar mark. They are too greedy if the did not turn their calls valued at 1.30 into 4,000 dollars. Nothing, I repeat nothing especially something as imperfect and speculative as amazon and its kindle and its online amazon green grocer is a sure shot. There will be those who, in this volatile market, will be happy to lock in their short term gains of 2-5 pts tomorrow before the turnaround back toward 275 commences. This exact pattern happened just two weeks ago when amzn peaked at 284 and then came back down to earth. Don't you recall that the 275 calls ended up valued @ zero come options exp? what i am writing here will all be a moot point come Friday afternoon June 28. Good luck.

Topic.Title: How is this company worth $125B????

Message.Msg: Excuse me, earnings are meaningless? Well what if the Kindle gets cloned in Peking? and it fails to ingnite the sensation of the Iphone or the Ipad of which I don't know if there has been a clone? Then you have a damn rignt conundrum the like of the Nook. I still read books. Nicely bound and aestically assembled and you can put a marker or a note or a picture at the point where you left off. Or at some important spot. It is a highly personal experience. It is a unique exchange between the author's state of being, his mind and soul, and that of yours. What you think is doomed to obsolescence is no more due to be discared than Shakespeare or the guitar or the violin or the physical drums themselves. Come back and check the aesthetics in 5 years. There will not be a completely Matixified World. There will still be bookbinding and ;pictures and art. It is part of our persistent genetic motherboard. Indeed. You can try to make a device of speed and convenience but you cannot identically duplicate the experience and the tactile purity of turning the pages of an art book or an art magazine. Sure it's new, But that's where it ends. It will not rule the art world. Not yet. Ciao.

Topic.Title: How is this company worth $125B????

Message.Msg: Unless the cartel wants to run it to new highs on the back of the overall market. Remember, the cartel always controls AMZN in the short term, especially when the macro backdrop of Fed and global easy money are the tailwind. Bad news is the new good, and a slowing GDP means less taper, if ever. The macro economy is in freefall, on the back of China slowing and recognizing the prudence of the slowdown. But AMZN is the poster child for the FED induced mania, and that despite Bernankes kabuki theater, is not likely to happen on his watch. And if Janet Yellen gets the job as an Obama plea for more women votes in 2016, the FED will be even easier on her watch. Imagine that. AMZN will fall hard when the US market ultimately cracks. It will be spectacular. But I do not think it is ready for the crash yet. A push to new highs seems to cause more pain and is the path of least resistance. We will see tomorrow.

Topic.Title: KRE Regional Banks new Highs

Message.Msg: Room and board has to keep pace with tuition (/sarc) but off campus student housing hasn't appreciated enough (especially with lower interest rates) to keep pace with on campus R&B increases. Thus, rents have risen more than mortgage payments to finance and the cash flow yield of said properties has risen. I suspect there are opps in most smaller Midwest university towns that get no attention from big money players.

Topic.Title: KRE Regional Banks new Highs

Message.Msg: Cash: Just to remind you, I started with by saying real estate is likely to lose less than purely financial assets. I am not suggesting that OCH will appreciate further, especially short term. Nor am I claiming that it is the best real estate investment idea, but rather that were I to be investing in real estate, I'd be careful to look at the state/muni finances and property with solid cash flows likely to be more resilient and offered Indiana OCH. With that said and just for fun, let's look at your critique: C: taxes are heading up T: That's why I suggested Indiana as an example of a state whose finances are much better and will not have the same property tax increase that we will see here in Illinois... C: rates are heading up T: That affects all real estate as a class and this thought experiment was about trying to identify a real estate investment that could make sense... C: affordability is going down T: Agreed, but if we ever do get wage inflation, which is likely to within the window of the mortgage, that would reverse C: prices are heading down T: Agreed, but if the property works on a cash flow basis, rates are locked in and one chooses a geography with sound finances that doesn't need to increase taxes, one doesn't have to worry about prices unless rental prices drop to the point where one cannot cover the net carrying cost (if starting with positive cash flow, should have a buffer) C: supply of the houses for rent is going up T: True in aggregate, but I'm not sure that claim is true with respect houses proximate to universities C: rental prices are going down T: Could be the case with OCH, although not where I looked. C: student loan rates to double this summer, number of students will stay the same or go down, no? T: Probably, but impact will likely vary by school... Choose wisely. "NO MONEY and BELOW market with CASH BACKS" is a neat trick and one I never learned. I guess that's why I focus on tech and not real estate...

Message.Title: The question is not IF but the question is WHEN?
Message.Msg: "We believe deceleration in Amazon’s North America Media revenue segment is increasingly likely for 2Q13," says Barclays in a note helping Amazon (AMZN -0.8%) shares fall on an up day. The firm's remarks come a couple days after Barnes & Noble delivered ugly May quarter numbers and FY14 guidance (though share losses to Amazon were almost certainly a culprit). Lifted by e-book sales, Amazon's North American Media sales rose 14% Y/Y in Q1 to $2.5B, and made up 16% of revenue. International media sales rose only 1%... When will the ride down commence as it did during May's expiration cycle? Anyone wish to dare to call it?
